DataElement.preferredName: Pathology Submitter Physician Fourth Report Physician License Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: License number of physician submitting specimens for the fourth path report.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A specialty concerned with the nature and cause of disease as expressed by changes in cellular or tissue structure and function caused by the disease process. (MSH98)_A person who presents or submits something (e.g., a proposal or protocol) for formal consideration or review by others._Physician; a licensed medical practitioner.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

Property.preferredDefinition: A person who presents or submits something (e.g., a proposal or protocol) for formal consideration or review by others.:Physician; a licensed medical practitioner.

Concepts.definition: A person who presents or submits something (e.g., a proposal or protocol) for formal consideration or review by others.
A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Following the third position in an ordering or series; coming next after the third and just before the fifth in position._Report; a short account._Physician; a licensed medical practitioner._Official or legal permission to do or own a specified thing._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Following the third position in an ordering or series; coming next after the third and just before the fifth in position.:Report; a short account.:Physician; a licensed medical practitioner.:Official or legal permission to do or own a specified thing.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: Following the third position in an ordering or series; coming next after the third and just before the fifth in position.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.
A doctor; a person who has been educated, trained, and licensed to practice the art and science of medicine; a practitioner of medicine, as contrasted with a surgeon.
Official or legal permission to do or own a specified thing.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 12.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (6/2010)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Path Order Phys Lic 4 Comment
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data item accommodates only one path report; if an additional path report was prepared, enter the license number of physician in Path Order Phys Lic No 5 [7104]. Information in this data item should refer to the path report described in data items 7013, 7023, 7193, and 7483.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Rationale
ReferenceDocuments.description: Describes the origin of the fourth pathology report contributing to this cancer abstract.
